IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: BUILDING ON THE LEGACY OF ITS FOUNDING FAMILY, THE WILSON MUSEUM USES ITS DIVERSE COLLECTIONS AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE LEARNING EXPERIENCES TO STIMULATE EXPLORATION OF THE NATURAL HISTORY AND CULTURES OF THE PENOBSCOT BAY REGION AND THE WORLD.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BUILDING ON THE LEGACY OF ITS FOUNDING FAMILY, THE WILSON MUSEUM USES ITS DIVERSE COLLECTIONS AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE LEARNING EXPERIENCES TO STIMULATE EXPLORATION OF THE NATURAL HISTORY AND CULTURES OF THE PENOBSCOT BAY REGION AND THE WORLD.
IRS990.Desc: WILSON MUSEUM - CARE, MAINTENANCE, ADMINISTRATION AND INTERPRETATION OF A 4,500 SQUARE FOOT MUSEUM AND WORLDWIDE COLLECTIONS FROM PREHISTORY TO THE PRESENT DAY INCLUDING EDUCATIONAL SERVICE SUCH AS PUBLICATIONS, LECTURES, DEMONSTRATIONS, AND WEBSITE. OPEN FROM MAY 25 TO SEPTEMBER 30, GROUPS BY APPOINTMENT DURING THE OFF-SEASON. MUSEUM ATTENDANCE OF 5,475.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION CENTER & DEMONSTRATION/EXHIBIT AREA - CARE, MAINTENANCE, AND INTERPRETATION OF EXHIBITION/DEMONSTRATION BUILDINGS, A FULLY FUNCTIONAL 19TH CENTURY SMITHY, AND A 3,000 SQUARE FOOT EDUCATION CENTER WHERE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES SUCH AS LECTURES, DEMONSTRATIONS AND EXHIBITS ARE OFFERED ON A YEAR-ROUND BASIS. APPROXIMATE EDUCATION CENTER & DEMONSTRATION EXHIBIT AREA ATTENDANCE OF 1,000.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: JOHN & PHEBE PERKINS HOUSE, PERKINS GALLERY & MUSEUM STORE - CARE, MAINTENANCE, AND INTERPRETATION OF EXHIBITION, MUSEUM STORE AND A 2 STORY COLONIAL HOME, BUILT IN 1763/83 WHICH IS ON THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES, AS WELL AS THE CARE OF THE COLLECTIONS WITHIN, INCLUDING FAMILY HEIRLOOMS, LOCAL ARTIFACTS, AND PERIOD PIECES. HISTORIC HOME OPEN JULY AND AUGUST AND BY APPOINTMENT WITH GUIDED TOURS AND DEMONSTRATIONS SUCH AS FIRESIDE COOKING. GALLERY & MUSEUM STORE OPEN MAY 27TH TO SEPTEMBER 30TH, GROUPS BY APPOINTMENT DURING THE OFF-SEASON. PERKINS HOUSE, GALLERY & MUSEUM STORE ATTENDANCE OF 2,083.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES - OUTREACH TO AREA SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. APPROXIMATELY 150 PERSONS IMPACTED.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: PART II, SECTION B LINE 8: GROSS INCOME FROM INTEREST/DIVIDEND ETC., IS REDUCED AS A RESULT OF EARNINGS FROM UNUSUAL GIFTS AS DETAILED BELOW: 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 TOTAL GROSS 343,511 408,144 401,032 329,432 306,629 FROM UNUSAL (337,844) (399,709) (383,709) (306,283) (251,729 -------- -------- -------- -------- -------- PART II SECT B LINE 8 INTEREST AND DIVIDENDS 5,667 8,435 17,323 23,139 54,900 PART II SECT B LINE 8 RENT 1,720 320 5,438 200 6,256 -------- -------- -------- -------- -------- PART II SECT B TOTAL 7,387 8,755 22,761 23,339 61,156

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 1, PART II, LINE 5
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A BRIEF LIST OF WHAT TO LOOK FOR AND TO REPORT ON EACH YEAR WHEN THE ISLAND IS VISITED. ANY CHANGES TO THE LAND AND BUILDINGS THAT HAVE OCCURRED SINCE THE LAST INSPECTION WILL BE NOTED AND ADDRESSED APPROPRIATELY. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT CURRENTLY HAVE A SPECIFIC POLICY FOR HANDLING ANY VIOLATIONS. HOWEVER, ANY VIOLATIONS WOULD BE ADDRESSED WITH THE PROPERTY OWNER WITH THE EXPECTATION THAT ANY FINDINGS WOULD BE IMMEDIATELY REMEDIED. DURING 2022, ONE TRUSTTE AND THREE STAFF/VOLUNTEERS PERFORMED THE INSPECTION AND SPENT APPROXIMATELY FIVE HOURS GETTING TO THE ISLAND, PERFORMING THE INSPECTION AND RETURNING TO THE MAIN LAND. OVERALL TWENTY TOTAL HOURS WERE SPENT MONITORING THE CONSERVATION EASEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 1, PART II, LINE 9
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CASTINE SCIENTIFIC SOCIETY IS THE HOLDER OF A CONSERVATION EASEMENT PERTAINING TO NAUTILUS ISLAND, A THIRTY ACRE ISLAND SITUATED IN CASTINE HARBOR IN EAST PENOBSCOT BAY. THE ORGANIZATION WAS GRANTED THE EASEMENT BY THE ESTATE OF ELLENORE DOUDIET ON MAY 11, 2006. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE EASEMENT IS TO PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC BENEFIT BY PROTECTING AND PRESERVING NAUTILUS ISLAND IN PERPETUITY IN ITS SUBSTANTIALLY NATURAL AND UNDEVELOPED CONDITION AND TO PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT OF THE ISLAND. CASTINE SCIENTIFIC SOCIETY, ITS SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS ARE GRANTED CERTAIN AFFIRMATIVE RIGHTS INCLUDING ACCESS TO THE PROPERTY FOR INSPECTION, MONITORING, AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE TERMS OF THE CONSERVATION EASEMENT. AS THE HOLDER OF THE CONSERVATION EASEMENT, CASTINE SCIENTIFIC SOCIETY HAS NOT ASSIGNED ANY VALUE OR REPORTED THE EASEMENT IN ITS STATEMENT OF FINANCIAL POSITION OR STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 1, PART III, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COLLECTIONS ARE MAINTAINED FOR PUBLIC EXHIBITION, EDUCATION, AND RESEARCH IN FURTHERANCE OF PUBLIC SERVICE, RATHER THAN FOR FINANCIAL GAIN. COLLECTION ITEMS INCLUDE PREHISTORIC ARTIFACTS FROM AROUND THE WORLD, SHIP MODELS, WEAPONS, CERAMICS, ROCKS AND MINERALS, TOOLS, AND OTHER FARM AND HOME EQUIPMENT. IN ADDITION, THE COLLECTION INCLUDES LETTERS, DIARIES, SHIP LOGS, BUSINESS PAPERS, AND MAPS. THE MUSEUM OVERSEES THE MAINTENANCE AND PRESERVATION OF ALL COLLECTION ITEMS WITH THE PRESUMPTION OF PERMANENCE, CARE, DOCUMENTATION, AND ACCESSIBILITY. DURING 2022, DONATIONS CONSISTING OF HISTORICAL ARTIFACTS, BOOKS AND ARTWORK WERE DONATED TO THE COLLECTION BY FIVE DIFFERENT INDIVIDUALS. PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS, IF ANY, ARE RECORDED SEPARATELY IN THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES AS A DECREASE IN NET ASSETS. A PAINTING AND SNOWSHOES WERE PURCHASED FOR THE COLLECTION IN 2022. IT IS THE MUSEUM'S POLICY TO DESCRIBE ANY ITEMS GIVEN AWAY, DAMAGED, DESTROYED, LOST, OR OTHERWISE DE-ACCESSED DURING THE PERIOD. IN ADDITION, ANY FUNDS REALIZED FROM THE SALE OF MATERIALS OR OBJECTS DEACCESSIONED FROM COLLECTIONS ARE APPLIED TO THE PURCHASE OF ADDITIONS TO THE COLLECTION OR FOR CONSERVATION OF THE COLLECTIONS OF THE MUSEUM.IN 2022, THE MUSEUM REPATRIATED THE REMAINS OF 6 INDIVIDUALS TO THE WABANAKI INTERTRIBAL REPATRIATION COMMITTEE (WIRC), ALONG WITH SEVERAL ASSOCIATED ARTIFACTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART III, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE WILSON MUSEUM EXHIBITS, INTERPRETS, AND MAKES AVAILABLE FOR RESEARCH ITS COLLECTIONS TO STIMULATE VISITORS INTO THE EXPLORATION OF NATURAL HISTORY AND CULTURES OF THE PENOBSCOT BAY REGION OF MAINE AND THE WORLD, WHICH IS THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION. THE HEART OF THE WILSON MUSEUM IS THE COLLECTIONS OF PHYSICAL OBJECTS AND MATERIALS, AND THEREFORE, MOST ACTIVITIES REVOLVE AROUND THEIR PROTECTION, INTERPRETATION, AND PROPER USE. THESE COLLECTIONS ARE GROUPED IN SEVERAL CATEGORIES, ALL DESIGNED FOR FURTHERING THE MUSEUM'S MISSION. THE PERMANENT COLLECTION IS THE MAIN COLLECTION OF: "CULTURAL" OBJECTS (ARCHEOLOGICAL, ETHNOGRAPHIC, AND CONTEMPORARY); HISTORIC AND LOCAL OBJECTS (TOOLS AND UTENSILS, TEXTILES, AMUSEMENTS, FURNITURE, WEAPONS, A PRE-REVOLUTIONARY HOUSE, ARCHIVAL MATERIALS, ETC.); OTHER SUPPORTING COLLECTIONS INCLUDE: AN EDUCATION COLLECTION OF OBJECTS INTENDED FOR HANDLING AND USE IN EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS; EXHIBITION COLLECTIONS WHICH INCLUDE OBJECTS USED TO ADD EXHIBITION CONTEXT; RESEARCH COLLECTION WHICH INCLUDE SPECIMENS AND SAMPLES THAT CAN BE ANALYZED FOR RESEARCH OR USED AS REFERENCE SPECIMENS; AND A LENDING LIBRARY COLLECTION WHICH ARE DUPLICATES OF ARCHIVAL COLLECTIONS FOR LENDING TO STAFF, VOLUNTEERS OR VISITORS. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS A FIDUCIARY DUTY TO STEWARD THE MUSEUM'S COLLECTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INTENDED USE OF THE QUASI-ENDOWMENT FUND IS TO PROVIDE THE ORGANIZATION WITH PREDICTABLE AND GROWING INVESTMENT INCOME AND APPRECIATION OF PRINCIPAL THROUGH THE PRUDENT SELECTION OF QUALITY INVESTMENTS. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES INCLUDES OFFSETTING THE EFFECTS OF INFLATION, PROTECTING PRINCIPAL AND PROVIDING THE ORGANIZATION WITH DISCRETIONARY INCOME NECESSARY TO HELP OFFSET OPERATING EXPENSES WHILE INCREASING THE BASE VALUE OF THE UNDERLYING ASSET. FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED FROM THE QUASI-ENDOWMENT TO SUPPORT ANNUAL OPERATIONS OF THE ORGANIZATION BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE. IN 2020 DONOR RETRICTED ASSETS WERE ADDED TO THE FUND FOR THE SUPPORT OF AN INTERN PROGRAM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 2D

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUILDING ON THE LEGACY OF ITS FOUNDING FAMILY, THE WILSON MUSEUM USES ITS DIVERSE COLLECTIONS AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE LEARNING EXPERIENCES TO STIMULATE EXPLORATION OF THE NATURAL HISTORY AND CULTURES OF THE PENOBSCOT BAY REGION AND THE WORLD.
OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES - OUTREACH TO AREA SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. APPROXIMATELY 150 PERSONS IMPACTED.

THE VOTING MEMBERSHIP OF THE WILSON MUSEUM CONSISTS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE NON-VOTING MEMBERSHIP OF THE WILSON MUSEUM CONSISTS OF GENERAL MEMBERS. THESE ARE ONE-YEAR DUES PAYING INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS, FAMILY MEMBERS, STUDENT MEMBERS, AND ONE-TIME DUES PAYING LIFE MEMBERS. GENERAL MEMBERS HAVE NO VOTING RIGHTS.

THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE DIRECTOR AND THE TREASURER BY THE PAID PREPARER. THE TREASURER SUBSEQUENTLY PROVIDES THE DRAFT TO THE BOARD, ALLOWING AT LEAST ONE WEEK FOR THE MEMBERS TO REVIEW THE DOCUMENT. THE BOARD THEN VOTES TO ACCEPT AND FILE THE DOCUMENT AS PRESENTED. IF NOT ACCEPTED, AND AS NEEDED, THE BOARD REQUESTS THE PREPARER FILE AN EXTENSION IN ORDER TO RESOLVE ANY DISCREPANCIES PRIOR TO FILING.THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE DIRECTOR AND THE TREASURER BY THE PAID PREPARER. THE TREASURER SUBSEQUENTLY PROVIDES THE DRAFT TO THE BOARD, ALLOWING AT LEAST ONE WEEK FOR THE MEMBERS TO REVIEW THE DOCUMENT. THE BOARD THEN VOTES TO ACCEPT AND FILE THE DOCUMENT AS PRESENTED. IF NOT ACCEPTED, AND AS NEEDED, THE BOARD REQUESTS THE PREPARER FILE AN EXTENSION IN ORDER TO RESOLVE ANY DISCREPANCIES PRIOR TO FILING.

IN ORDER TO MONITOR THE WILSON MUSEUM'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, COVERED PERSONS WILL ANNUALLY DISCLOSE (IN WRITING) ANY CONFLICTS OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AS WELL AS REVIEW THE POLICY AND SIGN AN ACKNOWLEDGEMENT STATEMENT. PROCEDURES FOR IDENTIFYING AND ADDRESSING CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND VIOLATIONS TO THE POLICY ARE OUTLINED IN DETAIL WITHIN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ADOPTED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ON SEPTEMBER 22, 2009 AND MAY INCLUDE DISCIPLINARY AND/OR CORRECTIVE ACTIONS.

IF A NEW EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WERE TO BE HIRED, COMPENSATION WOULD BE SET BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AFTER A REVIEW OF COMPENSATION LEVELS AT OTHER MAINE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WITH COMPARABLE BUDGETS AND PROGRAMS. THE REVIEW WOULD SERVE AS GUIDANCE TO THE BOARD, BUT NOT BE THE ONLY DETERMINANT OF COMPENSATION LEVEL. ANY FUTURE ADJUSTMENTS IN COMPENSATION MAY BE MADE BY THE BOARD AS IT SEES FIT. NORMALLY, THIS WILL OCCUR THROUGH THE ANNUAL BUDGET PROCESS. THE BOARD MAY CONSIDER INCREASES IN COMPENSATION AS COST OF LIVING ADJUSTMENTS, AS THE RESULT OF ORGANIZATIONAL GROWTH, AND/OR TO REWARD EXCEPTIONAL JOB PERFORMANCE. THE BOARD MAY ALSO CONSIDER DECREASES IN COMPENSATION, DEPENDING ON THE FISCAL HEALTH OF THE ORGANIZATION AND/OR JOB PERFORMANCE. BEFORE MAKING ANY COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS IN EXCESS OF 5% (UP OR DOWN), THE BOARD SHALL ONCE AGAIN REVIEW COMPENSATION LEVELS AT OTHER MAINE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO GUIDE ITS DECISIONS.

THE WILSON MUSEUM MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, INCLUDING ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION BY KEEPING A COPY ON FILE IN THE MUSEUM'S OFFICE WHICH MAY BE VIEWED UPON REQUEST. FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE ON-LINE THROUGH CANDID.ORG
